titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Jules David Prown Research Material on Artists, 1935-2010, bulk 1958-1975, in the Archives of American Art AAA.prowjule
Prown (Jules David) research material on artists
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart

note.p: This finding aid is associated with a MARC collection-level record. 239353

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-05-23T11:04-0400

did.unittitle: Jules David Prown research material on artists
did.abstract: Jules David Prown research material on artists measures 11.6 linear feet and dates from 1935 to 2010, with the bulk of the material dating from 1958 to 1975. Prown, an art historian and educator, is an authority on the work of artist John Singleton Copley, and these papers contain related notes, subject files, correspondence, portrait and attribution files, and photographs of artwork. Also found are Prown’s research files on other artists, including Benjamin West, typescripts of his lectures, and copies of his published writings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as 4 series. The original order of the donor was maintained.

list.item: Series 1: Research Material on John Singleton Copley, 1935-2010 (8.6 linear feet; Boxes 1-9)
Series 2: Research Material on Benjamin West, 1967-1990s (1.2 linear feet; Boxes 9-10, 12-13)
Series 3: Research Material on Other Artists, 1950s-2008 (0.4 linear feet; Box 9)
Series 5: Printed Material, 1960-2000 (0.3 linear feet; Box 11)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Jules David Prown research material on artists are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Jules David Prown in 2003, 2010, and 2014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Jules David Prown research material on artists, 1935-2010. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed to a minimal level and a finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart in 2013 and 2014. The collection has been minimally rearranged and retains the existing/original folder titles when possible. All materials have been rehoused in archival folders and boxes for long-term stability, but often staples and other fasteners have not been removed. Materials within folders have not been rearranged.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Art historian Jules David Prown (1930- ) is a Paul Mellon Professor Emeritus of the History of Art at Yale University, New Haven, Connecticut. He is an authority on American art and material culture. Prown is a graduate of Lafayette College and the Winterthur Program in Early American Culture at the University of Delaware. He received his Ph.D. from Harvard University in 1961 with a dissertation on John Singleton Copley. That year he joined the faculty of the Department of the History of Art at Yale University where he was also Curator of American Art at the University Art Gallery and the founding Director of the Yale Center for British Art. In 1966 he published the two-volume John Singleton Copley. While working on the publication he conducted an in-depth computer analysis of Copley’s 240 American sitters. Prown retired from Yale in 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Jules David Prown research material on artists measures 11.6 linear feet and dates from 1935 to 2010, with the bulk of the material dating from 1958 to 1975. Prown, an art historian and educator, is an authority on the work of artist John Singleton Copley, and these papers contain related notes, subject files, correspondence, portrait and attribution files, and photographs of artwork. Also found are Prown’s research files on other artists, including Benjamin West, typescripts of his lectures, and copies of his published writings.

The bulk of the collection consists of Prown’s research material on the work of John Singleton Copley, including notes and correspondence he compiled while working on his dissertation and later two-volume work John Singleton Copley. Of interest are a set of notes regarding the computer analysis of sitters of John Singleton Copley. Included are detailed biographical forms for each sitter and lists of codes and cross references used for Prown's computer analysis. Topics of his notes and subject files include biographical information on Copley, technique and materials, specific works of art such as Watson and the Shark, and painting themes. Correspondence found throughout his research files usually discuss dates of paintings, attribution, and provenance. Photographs and related printed material are often included with correspondence.

did.unittitle: Research Material on John Singleton Copley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are Prown’s research files regarding the work of artist John Singleton Copley. Much of this research material was compiled for his 1966 publication, John Singleton Copley. Later documentation primarily concerns attribution. Included are research notes, subject files, correspondence, files regarding portraits and attribution, and photographs of artwork. Researchers should note that lectures regarding Copley are included in Series 3: Lectures, and Prown’s published articles on Copley are included in Series 4: Printed Material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is arranged as 6 subseries:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes primarily consist of notecards which Prown grouped by subject. Notecards often include attached photographs, printed material, correspondence, and artwork information sheets. Prown filed his notes separately from his other research files, but topics such as attribution, portrait sitters, and other subject files often overlap and all sets of material should be consulted. Also of interest is a set of notes regarding the computer analysis of sitters of John Singleton Copley. Included are detailed biographical forms for each sitter and lists of codes and cross references used for Prown's computer analysis.

did.unittitle: "Analysis of Sitters of J. S. Copley, 1753-1774"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subject files include draft writings, correspondence, printed material, photographs, notes, and draft writings. Topics include biographical information on Copley, technique and materials, specific works of art such as Watson and the Shark, and painting themes. Subject files are closely related to the notes found in subseries 1.1.

did.unittitle: Exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art

unittitle.emph: Offer of the Crown to Lady Jane Gray

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here is correspondence primarily documenting the period during the 1960s that Prown was researching his dissertation and subsequent book on John Singleton Copley. Correspondence is with art collectors, universities, museums, and libraries regarding Copley's works, fact checking, and requests for photographs and permission to publish. Letters are arranged alphabetically by name or location.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Portrait files contain correspondence regarding specific portraits by Copley and often include attached photographs and printed material. Letters discuss provenance, date of the works, biographical information on sitters, and requests to look at the works in person. Documents are arranged alphabetically by name of sitter. Related notes on sitters, including Prown's computer analysis of sitters, can be found in Subseries 1.1 and correspondence regarding portraits with questionable attribution can be found in Subseries 1.5.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Attribution files primarily consist of correspondence asking for Prown's expertise on attributing works to John Singleton Copley. Letters often include provenance details and attached photographs and related printed material. Documents were grouped by Prown according to attribution status and within those groupings are arranged alphabetically by sitter. Additional notes on attribution can be found in Subseries 1.1.

did.unittitle: Attribution of Paintings and Drawings Unknown
"A Checklist of English Paintings Attributed Erroneously to John Singleton Copley"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of artwork include copyprints of works by Copley from various museums and art collections. Some photographs include detailed annotations on the verso. Most photographs are arranged alphabetically by sitter or grouped by theme. Miscellaneous photographs found here are unsorted copyprints of works by Copley. Researchers should note that many additional photographs can be found attached to correspondence and notes within the other series in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are Prown’s research files regarding the work of artist Benjamin West. Included are research notes, subject files, correspondence, and photographs of artwork.

did.unittitle: Notes on Historical Painting, Background, Other Artists
Notes on West and Leo III
Notes on St. George's Chapel Windsor
Notes on Attitudes Toward and Evaluation of Benjamin West

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are Prown’s research files on other artists. Files on individual artists typically contain correspondence, photographs of artwork, and notes. Additionally there is correspondence regarding attribution of artwork by various artists, which also include related notes and photographs. Also found here is one file of research essays written by students.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Portraits by Various Artists

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are draft lectures with handwritten edits, slide lists, notes, and other related documents. Lectures were written for college courses, conferences, and award ceremonies. Prown arranged most of his lectures by subject, but most drafts are annotated with the name of the specific event, location, and date. Many of the lectures are on the subjects of John Singleton Copley and material culture.

did.unittitle: Whitney Lecture: Whister, Homer, and Eakins

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed material includes copies of published journal and magazine articles, book chapters, and essays by Jules David Prown. Also found are a few articles on art history written by others.

did.unittitle: Published Writings by Jules David Prown
